apps.name: punkt
apps.description: News on your wrist. Nothing more.
apps.fullDescription: Punkt is a minimalist RSS reader for Apple Watch. Your feeds, synced from your iPhone, readable at a glance. No phone required. Your phone is a distraction machine. Every time you reach for it to check the news, you're three notifications away from losing 20 minutes. Punkt keeps it simple: glance at your watch, read a headline, move on with your day.
features: Minimal by design — No ads, no algorithmic feeds, no engagement tricks. Just your news, in chronological order.
Instant sync — Add a feed on your iPhone and it's on your watch within seconds.
Swipe to browse — Navigate through articles with a simple swipe.
Listen when your eyes are busy — Tap the Listen button and Punkt reads the article aloud. Adjust speed and volume right from your wrist.
Multilingual — Punkt handles feeds in any language.
No account required, no tracking, no social features, no infinite scroll.

apps.name: Bulletin
apps.fullDescription: Bulletin is a thoughtfully designed RSS reader built exclusively for Miniflux. If you've chosen to self-host your feeds, you deserve a client that respects that decision.
features: Two ways to read — Switch between Accordion mode for quick scanning and Editorial mode for immersive, magazine-style reading. Five intelligent layouts adapt to your content.
Filter the noise — Create blocklist and keeplist rules per feed. Block sponsored content, keep only the articles you care about. Your rules sync with Miniflux.
Reddit & YouTube, simplified — Paste any subreddit or YouTube channel URL and subscribe directly. No third-party services, no workarounds.
Designed with intention — Six themes ranging from warm cream to dark amber. Typography that respects long-form reading with 8 font families and adjustable sizing.
Smart features — Mark-as-read on scroll, Read Later list, feed health monitoring, full content fetching, offline reading with automatic sync, and per-feed display settings.
No account required, no tracking, no analytics. All data stored locally and on your Miniflux server.

apps.name: Orbit
apps.description: The music server built for serious collectors.
apps.fullDescription: Orbit is a self-hosted music server designed for audiophiles, vinyl collectors, and classical music enthusiasts who demand more than basic playback. Most music servers treat your library as a flat collection of files. They don't understand that your 1975 original pressing sounds different from your 2015 Mobile Fidelity remaster. They can't tell the difference between Beethoven's Symphony No. 5 conducted by Karajan versus Furtwängler. Orbit does.
features: Multiple versions per album — Every pressing, remaster, and edition tracked separately. Mark your favorite with a note explaining why.
Vinyl-first design — Track pressing details, label, matrix number, condition, equipment chain. Full Discogs integration.
Classical hierarchy — Proper Composer → Work → Movement → Recording structure. OpenOpus integration for authoritative metadata.
Hi-res audio support — Native DSD, SACD ISO extraction, full sample rate and bit depth tracking from 44.1kHz to 384kHz.
In-place mode — Read your existing library without moving or renaming files. Your organization, your rules.
Smart playlists — Filter by format, source, quality, ratings, custom tags. Combine rules with AND/OR logic.
Self-hosted — Your music, your hardware, no cloud required. SQLite or PostgreSQL. Full GraphQL API.
